snippet.textDisplay:
This ALWAYS takes me back to when I was a kid renting Chrono Trigger for the SNES and playing it for hours and hours straight and grinding level ups/techniques! My parents went ahead and just bought the game outright since it was from a "Mom and Pop" video store in my home town. 

Truly amazing times that you don't think will pass but you blink and you're in your 30s lol.
snippet.textOriginal:

Truly amazing times that you don't think will pass but you blink and you're in your 30s lol.

snippet.textDisplay: I had played only the beginning part several times (unsaving rom collection =0=) as a kid, then finally got to play the full thing on the DS. When I heard this theme, I immediately knew the game was gonna be AMAXING. It is easily my top 3 favourites from the entire game, the other two being To Far Away Times (Mitsuda himself cries to it <3) and Secret of the Forest.
snippet.textOriginal: I had played only the beginning part several times (unsaving rom collection =0=) as a kid, then finally got to play the full thing on the DS. I get so many sentimental, warm feelings whenever I hear this song.

snippet.textDisplay:
I never got to play this game as a kid. I eventually got the DS version.
It's funny, most people's opinions on games are bias and clouded by feelings of nostalgia. I have no nostalgic connection to this game, for better or worse, and yet I still loved it. I don't know if I would call it THE BEST game of its kind, I'm no RPG veteran. But, it did impress me quite a bit, for all that's worth, and I really wish I had played it as a kid. Really great game.
snippet.textOriginal:
I never got to play this game as a kid. I eventually got the DS version.
It's funny, most people's opinions on games are bias and clouded by feelings of nostalgia. I have no nostalgic connection to this game, for better or worse, and yet I still loved it. I don't know if I would call it THE BEST game of its kind, I'm no RPG veteran. But, it did impress me quite a bit, for all that's worth, and I really wish I had played it as a kid. Really great game.

snippet.textDisplay: I found a Jet Force Gemini cartdrige for my 64 recently, nostalgia level was over 9000 for like... ten seconds. Then the game grabbed me and there was no room left for anything else than quality entertainment.
snippet.textOriginal: I found a Jet Force Gemini cartdrige for my 64 recently, nostalgia level was over 9000 for like... ten seconds. Then the game grabbed me and there was no room left for anything else than quality entertainment.

snippet.textDisplay: @TimeyWimeyAura  I have to agree with TRexTurtle here. It's not nostalgia, it's just that those games ARE really good. I have to play Chrono Trigger and Super Metroid, but I'm pretty sure I won't be disapointed. I'm still playing most of my childhood SNES games, some of those are masterpieces (aLttP, Illusion of Gaia, SoM, Pocky & Rocky, SC IV, UN Squadron/Area 88, Axelay to name a few SNES games), and I know I'm not just biased, because I'm still finding incredible games. I recently played Demon's Crest on an emulator... oh boy. Gotta find that nearly 100$ cartdridge. And I don't wish I played those as a kid, because enjoying those games now as grown-ups proves that we're not just old farts blinded by nostalgia ;).
snippet.textOriginal: @TimeyWimeyAura  I have to agree with TRexTurtle here. It's not nostalgia, it's just that those games ARE really good. I have to play Chrono Trigger and Super Metroid, but I'm pretty sure I won't be disapointed. I'm still playing most of my childhood SNES games, some of those are masterpieces (aLttP, Illusion of Gaia, SoM, Pocky & Rocky, SC IV, UN Squadron/Area 88, Axelay to name a few SNES games), and I know I'm not just biased, because I'm still finding incredible games. I recently played Demon's Crest on an emulator... oh boy. Gotta find that nearly 100$ cartdridge. And I don't wish I played those as a kid, because enjoying those games now as grown-ups proves that we're not just old farts blinded by nostalgia ;).

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky, Thank you for posting these, I am a Landscape Architect and spend countless hours in studio, and I find that your playlists are the absolute perfect background noise for the creative process.  Many songs in video games are meant to be in the background and not be too distracting, and this is stuff is just perfect!  I've shown many people your page. Keep it up!
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky, Thank you for posting these, I am a Landscape Architect and spend countless hours in studio, and I find that your playlists are the absolute perfect background noise for the creative process.  Many songs in video games are meant to be in the background and not be too distracting, and this is stuff is just perfect!  I've shown many people your page. Keep it up!

@chronotrig100 

It's really coming to the Virtual Console on Wii??? Oh wooooow!!! I'm soooo excited now! This is DEFINITELY my favorite game of ALL time!!! Thanks for the info!! Chrono Trigger ftw!! There isn't a song in this game I don't like.. The soundtrack is absolutely magnificent and the gameplay and storyline are equally amazing!!! I HIGHLY recommend this game to any gamer! Best game ever imo!! :D

snippet.textDisplay: If ever there was a song which could get me teary-eyed, it's this song. I remember the first time I rented Chrono Trigger from Blockbuster, having no idea what to expect. 16 years later, the song evokes feelings of nostalgia and joy for my favorite game of all-time. Supra -- thanks for the trip down memory lane as usual.
snippet.textOriginal: If ever there was a song which could get me teary-eyed, it's this song. I remember the first time I rented Chrono Trigger from Blockbuster, having no idea what to expect. 16 years later, the song evokes feelings of nostalgia and joy for my favorite game of all-time. Supra -- thanks for the trip down memory lane as usual.

snippet.textDisplay:
Alright well I had a very busy week, everything should be back to normal now.

This is one of the first songs you hear in the game, when Crono wakes up. Very memorable and peaceful song. It shouldn't be too long before I'm ready to start my yearly playthrough of this game. ;)
